metadata.titel_preek: Why Jesus Had to Die: Because of What He Did!

locutie.beschrijving: A narrative retelling of Jesus healing the man with the withered hand, framed as a conflict between human need and religious/political protocols.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong narrative flow; focuses on socio-political implications of 'protocols' rather than christological identity.

illocutie.beschrijving: The primary force is describing the narrative and drawing parallels to modern social issues (stratification, racial protocols).
voorbeelden: The scene is set in the synagogue.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To make the hearer recognize their own 'disabilities' or 'complicity' in social protocols.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low; the Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the 'event'.

voorbeelden: The synagogue is the meeting place.
We canâ€™t dress it up pretty.
There will be a healing every time this text is performed!
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak; the promise is conditional on the 'performance' of the text rather than God's oath.

declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher describes Jesus' authority but does not exercise delegated authority (e.g., 'I announce to you').

constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a drama or a social critic, rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Information about healing without the 'event' of being healed.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Mostly 'we' (inclusive of preacher and congregation as observers).

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Hypothetical address to the Pharisees in the text.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Jesus, the man, and the Pharisees.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High; the sermon stays 'in the book' or 'in the world' rather than 'in the room'.

voorbeelden: This is the script... We need only to decide the role.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'healing' is described as a possibility, but never actually bestowed upon the hearer through a commissive.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: Because he did this (Indicative), you must decide (Imperative).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a brilliant socio-rhetorical lecture on the text but fails to transition into a sacramental event where God speaks to the hearer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The triangle is tense. Mark is terse.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: We can be the man... we can be the authorities.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Turns the gospel into a menu of options for the hearer to choose from.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The 'event' is talked about as something that happens 'every time this text is performed,' but the preacher doesn't actually perform the act of healing/promising.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The sermon remains at the level of 'talking about' (constative) rather than 'doing' (performative).

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No; Jesus is an actor in a past story.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is left to the hearer's 'decision' rather than the Spirit's work through the Word.
tekstueel_bewijs: We need only to decide the role.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No; the sermon is a 'script' for us to act out.
tekstueel_bewijs: It is the script of our life.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Over-reliance on descriptive 'to be' verbs and third-person narratives.

specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the name of Jesus, I say to you: Stretch out your withered heart; you are restored.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from reporting a miracle to performing a word of grace.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Grace is described as 'messianic juices' rather than a personal promise.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use direct address (2nd person) to apply the healing.
voorbeeldzinnen: Christ promises to break the protocols that bind you today.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the congregation directly as the ones with the withered hands.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, with your hidden disability, come forward.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative 'decide' is not founded on a declarative 'you are freed'.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Declare the restoration first, then call for the walk.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is intellectually stimulating and socially poignant, but it requires a shift from 'talking about' the drama to 'enacting' the drama through performative speech acts.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal'; SAT reveals the lack of a 'Declarative' act that changes the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the sermon is excellent (metaphors, pacing); SAT reveals it is illocutionarily 'hollow' because it lacks a Commissive.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the sermon's 'event-character' is claimed but not realized because the preacher remains a narrator rather than a mandatory.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: There will be a healing every time this text is performed!
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Low; it predicts a result rather than bestowing it.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Constative Surplus' where the preacher explains the mechanics of the gospel without pulling the trigger of the promise.
